creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: oval-shaped print: portrait of a seated man in cap with PL elbow resting on table; holding pipe in mouth with PL hand, and a bowl or pouch to the pipe with opposite hand; paraphernalia on table
marks:
Signature, Stamp

in pencil on verso: etch 152 | monogram in plate, upper left: [AV.O.] (with A and
provenance: Semen Nicolaevitch Mossoloff (1812-1880); [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until November 16, 1985; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: The Smoker
